title: Clue scroll (easy)

properties.value: A clue scroll (easy) is a valuable random drop from a large variety of lower-levelled monsters. Clue scrolls are the start of a Treasure Trail - a treasure hunt that sends players hunting all around Gielinor. At the end of the hunt players receive a reward of items randomly selected from a specific list, possibly including very rare and very valuable items.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Clue scroll (easy)
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.

A clue scroll (easy) is a valuable random drop from a large variety of lower-levelled monsters. Clue scrolls are the start of a Treasure Trail - a treasure hunt that sends players hunting all around Gielinor. At the end of the hunt players receive a reward of items randomly selected from a specific list, possibly including very rare and very valuable items.

For a guide on how to complete a clue scroll, see Treasure Trails Guide.

As for all tiers of clue scrolls, only one easy clue scroll can be held or in a bank at one time.

Easy clue scrolls are the easiest to obtain and complete in P2P, and offer lower rewards in return. The rewards can range from black equipment to wizard robes (g). A quick way to get easy clue scrolls is by pickpocketing H.A.M. Members in Lumbridge (note: wearing H.A.M. robes does not increase pickpocket success rate, but does decrease the chance of being kicked out of the hideout on pickpocket failure.[1]) Another method is killing thugs in Edgeville wilderness dungeon while wearing a ring of wealth (i).

Easy clue scrolls do not feature any co-ordinate clues, and require nothing to be fought. They also do not take the player into the Wilderness.

This clue scroll may contain the following types of clue:

  • Emote clues
  • Cryptic clues
  • Maps
  • Music

Completion of easy clues will give another clue or a casket, containing the final reward for the trail. After completing 500 easy clues, the player will be awarded a large spade.

If a player dies in the Wilderness with a clue scroll above level 20, it will disappear whether it's a PvP death or not, unless it is an item kept on death, or if that player has a clue box. Players will find that the clue scroll will be gone upon returning to their loot otherwise. In lower level Wilderness, unprotected clue scrolls will stay on the ground for an hour if killed by another player, or remain in the inventory if killed by a monster.

An easy clue scroll can be given to Watson along with a medium, hard and elite clue scroll in order to receive a master clue scroll. It is also possible to receive a master clue scroll as a reward for completing the easy scroll, at a 1/50 rate.

Easy clue scrolls can be between 2 and 4 steps long.

Contents

  • 1 Entrana method
  • 2 Requirements
    • 2.1 Skill requirements
    • 2.2 Quest requirements
    • 2.3 Music requirements
  • 3 Possible rewards
  • 4 Item sources
  • 5 Changes
    • 5.1 Gallery (historical)
  • 6 References

Entrana method[edit | edit source]

If the player opens an easy clue reward casket on Entrana, rolls for armour and weapons will be removed since they are not allowed on the island. This makes receiving god book pages more likely, and is recommended for faster book completion.[2][3]

For ironmen, Flared trousers, which are a master clue scroll item requirement, cannot be obtained if opening caskets on Entrana.

Requirements[edit | edit source]

Skill requirements

Certain clues will require items that need a certain skill requirement in order to wear or wield. The table below shows the highest skill requirement, in order to complete every easy clue.

Skill level Details
20 Required to wield mithril pickaxe.
20 Required to wear studded body.
20 Required to wear coif, studded body, and chaps.

Quest requirements[edit | edit source]

Some clues require access to areas which may require quests. Some only require to start the quest in order to access the area.

Quest Details
The Corsair Curse (partial completion) Gives access to Corsair Cove.
Priest in Peril Gives access to Canifis.

Music requirements[edit | edit source]

Music Track Unlock location
Alone Ice Mountain
On the Shore Corsair Cove
Rugged Terrain Shayzien Graveyard of Heroes
The Forlorn Homestead Southern coast of Hosidius
Tiptoe Draynor Manor cellar
Vision Wizards' Tower

Possible rewards[edit | edit source]

Main article: Reward casket (easy)

The average loot roll is worth 21,840. On average, easy clues are worth 65,521.

As well as the unique Treasure Trails rewards, players may also receive a variety of items such as black armour, black weapons, willow shortbows, coifs, leather armour, yew shortbows, salmon, trout and steel pickaxes.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
11 April 2019
(update)

The item was graphically updated.

9 March 2017
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 20.

21 April 2016
(update | poll)

Easy clue scrolls have been added to young, baby, and gourmet impling drop tables.

2 July 2015
(update | poll)

All clue scrolls now have a right-click 'Check steps' option that will allow you to see exactly how many steps you have completed so far.

18 June 2015
(update | poll)

You will now be able to have up to one clue scroll of each tier and will be able to complete clue scrolls of different tiers simultaneously.

14 May 2015
(update)

Clue scroll stages no longer increase when bouncing different clue scrolls.

6 March 2014
(update | poll)

The item was renamed from "Clue scroll" to "Clue scroll (easy)".

  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 5 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 26 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "It is the case, and I've been recommending people go there for prayerbook pages for years."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 23 December 2020. (Archived from the original on 12 January 2021.)
  4. ^ Jagex. Mod Tide's Twitter account. 24 May 2019. (Archived from the original on 24 May 2019.) Mod Tide: "I know its been a while since the clue expansion but here is the information on clue scroll drop rates and loot chances! If anything changes I will keep you posted."
